clinical_study.brief_title: Individualized PEEP Setting by EIT in Patients With ARDS
clinical_study.official_title: Individualized Positive End Expiratory Pressure(PEEP) Setting by EIT in Patients With Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome(ARDS)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators conducted a pilot study to compare the effect of Positive End Expiratory Pressure(PEEP) setting guide by lung electrical impedance tomography(EIT) and ARDS-net PEEP-FiO2 table on survival in subjects with mild/severe Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome(ARDS).

primary_outcome.description: PaO2(mmHg) measured by blood gas analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: length of ICU stay and mechanical ventilated day
secondary_outcome.description: Days of ICU stay and received mechanical ventilation(day)

secondary_outcome.measure: pneumothorax requiring chest tube during first 7 days; barotrauma during first 7 days;

arm_group.description: the Individualized PEEP titration by EIT was administered to the patients in the EIT group.
If patients are assigned to the control group, the Individualized PEEP Setting was by PEEP-FiO2 table based on ARDS-net protocol.

intervention.intervention_name: the EIT guide the individualized PEEP Setting
intervention.description: the EIT guide the individualized PEEP Setting in the EIT group
